intro: Ruellia delascioi, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Ruellia delascioi thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments.
